result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason NIEHAUS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC with intent to deliver(<=200 grams) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order Transferring Huber Privileges.
It is hereby orderd that the defendant will be granted huber privileges on count 2, under the Huber Law.  Transfer to Sauk County, Jefferson County or Columbia County is authorized provided defendant not be released on electronic monitoring.

Minutes.

Defendant requests counsel.  Initial appearance is reset to 07-27-15 at 2:30 p.m.
Notice of Hearing.
RE:  Possess Ecstacy with intent to deliver, on 06-29-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess Ecstacy with intent to deliver, possess THC with intent to deliver, possess methamphetamine and possess paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 07-20-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with Ashlei Miller and maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
